name: Bitwarden Unified
summary: Bitwarden (my favorite and recommended password manager) is offering a ‚Äúnew deployment option‚Äù. This new option combines all microservices into a single Docker container and doesn‚Äôt require 11 different containers anymore. And it supports PostgreSQL and MariaDB in addition to MS SQL.

content.html:
Achievement for today: I can finally correctly reply to Mastodon/Fediverse/ActivityPub posts. ü•≥

P.S.: And I can mention ActivityPub actors and they will get a notification (at least on Mastodon).

content.html:
Just setting up a quick Mastodon instance to test some compatibility is a pain. Using test accounts on public instances is also unreliable, because many instances are already overloaded and I don‚Äôt want to create spam. So I got a new DigitalOcean account with a $200 starter credit…

DigitalOcean has a simplified Mastodon setup and now I can try to improve my ActivityPub implementation during the next two months and then probably have to create a new DigitalOcean account.

By the way, happy holidays! üéÑ My family‚Äôs Christmas wasn‚Äôt as expected. On Wednesday evening I got sick (I guess it‚Äôs RSV). But my girlfriend and my sister are also sick. ü§í Today is my first day without fever, but it doesn‚Äôt feel like that.

content.html:
WordPress implemented SQLite support! üò± (Not merged into Core yet, but you‚Äôre able to test it.)

Update: Just tried the Performance Lab plugin with SQLite support enabled on a test WordPress instance using Docker. Do I see it right, that the plugin isn‚Äôt using SQLite WAL? That would probably give the whole thing a big speed boost. At least that‚Äôs what I do with GoBlog and my website is fast, right? ü§ì

name: ‚ÄúAirTags Expose Dodgy Postal Industry‚Äù
summary: Last year, YouTuber MegaLag tried to send several AirTag-ged packages from Germany to North Korea with DHL. But instead of arriving there, they were either misrouted to South Korea or ended up in China. In a new video, he further researches the reasons and also takes a look at DHL‚Äôs sorting center in Frankfurt at their invitation. Very interesting!

name: Bunny AI
summary: Bunny.net joined the AI hype and created ‚ÄúBunny AI‚Äù (docs), AI images created on the edge. I tried it out, because it‚Äôs currently free during the preview, but somehow I don‚Äôt find the generated images aesthetic or I‚Äôm just to stupid to write better prompts. I guess the Bunny developers also need some distraction from time to time, because they are working hard on S3 support for Bunny Storage for years already. üê∞

name: Like of: Go IndieWeb with GoBlog

content.html:
My website is powered by GoBlog, a simple and dynamic blogging system that‚Äôs open source, actively developed and implements most IndieWeb functionalities. It packages everything in a single binary and I‚Äôve been so over the moon using it and seeing it improve week after week that I‚Äôm surprised it isn‚Äôt more popular. So I put on my evangelist boots to share how I use this ‚Äústupidly-simple‚Äù blogging system to power my online presence.

Thanks, Andr√©s, for all your great improvement ideas, will to try out all the undocumented features, your feedback and for sharing GoBlog! üòÑ

name: Forgejo
summary: A few weeks ago, it came to light that Gitea has been owned by a for-profit Gitea Ltd. for several months. The lack of transparency has disturbed the trust of many contributors and users. That‚Äôs why Codeberg (a German based non-profit association - disclaimer: I am a member of the association) has now started a soft fork: Forgejo.

content.html:
I should write better tests or at least create some automatic tests. üò¨ (But ActivityPub is so complicated to test!)

Due to some mistakes in my blog‚Äôs ActivityPub implementation, I lost all my followers and my posts didn‚Äôt send. Glad that I have some backup and was able to reimport all followers from 2022-12-10 02:00. üòÖ If you followed me after that time, please re-follow to get my posts in your user‚Äôs inbox. üòä

And now, good night! üò¥
